subject: ARTS&SCI
catalog_description: This course is designed to prepare undergraduate students to teach their own half-credit house courses. This course will teach students how to design syllabi, create effective assignments/assessments, provide high-quality feedback as well as teaching them how to implement active learning strategies in the classroom. Furthermore, students will learn to design and implement foster inclusivity and equity in the classroom. This course also serves as a platform to for community-building and ongoing conversation among student instructors. This creates 'community of practice' in which you will be able to connect with your peers about best practices and challenges in the classroom.

subject: ARTS&SCI
catalog_description: We currently live in a geological age that some scientists call the Anthropocene. Although contested, the term does indicate the dominant role that humans and their activities now play in shaping the global climate. In turn, human-induced climate change poses the potential to dramatically disrupt the way we live today. The lessons we learn from past societies can help us understand our own place within the changing global climate.

subject: ARTS&SCI
descr: Contemporary Documentary Film: Filmmakers and the Full Frame Documentary Film Festival
catalog_description: Integrated with the films and filmmakers of the Full Frame Documentary Film Festival. The art form, style, and technology of contemporary documentary films. Issues of autonomy and power, politics, and public policies. Analysis of outstanding films from around the world. Presentations and discussions by filmmakers.

subject: ARTS&SCI
catalog_description: This course is designed to prepare Program II majors to design thesis and capstone projects aligned with their interdisciplinary course of study. Students will learn about quantitative and qualitative research methods appropriate to a variety of disciplinary approaches, including ethnography, archival research, visual and discourse analysis, survey design, and statistical analysis. Students will develop a research question, select methods, identify funding opportunities, and pursue IRB approval for human subjects research, culminating in a final project that includes a finished research proposal and timeline. Students will also learn about the importance of developing a writing practice and connecting intentionally with peers as emerging interdisciplinary scholars.
